entry.title: Douglas County Commissioners to Hold Public Hearing on Proposed Winchester Ridge Water District
entry.summary: Douglas County commissioners will hold a Jan. 7 public hearing to consider forming the Winchester Ridge Domestic Water Supply District. The proposal would create a new water utility entity for residents in the unincorporated Winchester Ridge area.

entry.title: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY FROM 4:00 P.M. SATURDAY TO 1:00 P.M. SUNDAY
entry.summary: January 3, 2025 6:15 a.m. A Winter Weather Advisory is in effect from 4:00 p.m. Saturday through 1:00 p.m. Sunday for the south-central Oregon Cascades including Crater Lake and Diamond Lake. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford said snow is expected above 5,000 feet. Total snow accumulation of 5 to 10 inches. Winds...

entry.title: Oran Mor Artisan Mead Closes Roseburg Tasting Room After 10 Years, Relocates Production Near Portland
entry.summary: After 10 years in Roseburg, Oran Mor Artisan Mead has closed its Roseburg tasting room following the relocation of its production closer to Portland. The company says it is not closing and will continue operating at its new location.

entry.title: Man Dies After Stabbing at “The Point” in Roseburg; Juvenile Taken Into Custody
entry.summary: Roseburg police responded to a reported stabbing near SE Pine Street Thursday morning where a 60-year-old man was found with a fatal stab wound. A juvenile suspect was later taken into custody. No further details have been released.

entry.title: 16-YEAR OLD CHARGED IN FATAL STABBING AT “THE POINT”
entry.summary: January 3, 2026 7:10 p.m. A 16-year-old male has been charged following a fatal stabbing near downtown Roseburg on Friday morning. A Roseburg Police report said at approximately 8:30 a.m. RPD along with the Douglas County Sheriff’s Office responded after a stabbing was reported in the 200 block of Southeast Pine Street, in an area...

entry.title: Police Log - January 1, 2026
entry.summary: Roseburg police reported multiple arrests on Jan. 1, including theft, criminal trespass, assault on an officer, and warrant cases. Several individuals were lodged at Douglas County Corrections following separate incidents across the city.

entry.title: SENATOR MERKLEY TO HOLD TOWN HALLS, INCLUDING IN DOUGLAS COUNTY
entry.summary: January 2, 2025 2:10 p.m. Oregon’s U.S. Senator Jeff Merkley has announced that he will hold his first town halls of the year, with in-person community conservations in several counties, including Douglas, over the next few days. The eight events kick-off Merkley’s 2026 town hall tour of Oregon, as he plans to hold a community...

entry.title: Youth programs at Roseburg Public Library
entry.summary: It’s a new year, and that means an updated youth program schedule at Roseburg Public Library.

entry.title: Cats are overtaking my garden!
entry.summary: Question: My garden is being overrun by uninvited cats. They dig up my raised bed vegetables, defecate in the soil and chew on my plants. What can I do to keep them out?

entry.title: LOCAL REAL ESTATE TODAY 1.02.26

entry.title: The remarkable story of Tyrone Powell

entry.title: New Oregon Waterway Permit Requirements Take Effect in 2026
entry.summary: Oregon’s new 2026 waterway rules require nearly all paddlecraft: kayaks, SUPs, rafts, and more - to carry a Waterway Access Permit. Fees start at $6, with funds supporting access, safety, and invasive species prevention statewide.

entry.title: DEPUTIES LOCATE INJURED BICYCLIST TUESDAY AFTERNOON

entry.title: LOW COMING ONSHORE TO BRING MORE RAIN TO THE UMPQUA VALLEY

entry.title: ROSEBURG RAINFALL TWENTY-FIVE PERCENT BELOW NORMAL FOR 2025
entry.summary: January 2, 2025 6:40 a.m. The Umpqua Valley received significantly less rainfall than normal in 2025. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford told News Radio 93-9 FM and 1240 KQEN that the Roseburg Regional Airport received 24.42 inches of rain from January 1st through December 31st. The normal rainfall amount for the year...

entry.title: DOUGLAS C.A.R.ES. SEEKING COMMUNITY SUPPORT TO HELP RE-OPEN
entry.summary: January 2, 2025 6:30 a.m. After recently announcing a pause in its operations, Douglas C.A.R.E.S. is seeking community support to help the non-profit organization reopen. A C.A.R.E.S. release said the county’s Child Advocacy Center has worked for over thirty years to help children who have experienced abuse, neglect, or sexual assault receive expert, compassionate medical...

entry.title: Douglas C.A.R.E.S to Temporarily Suspend Services Amid Funding Crisis
entry.summary: Facing financial strain, Douglas C.A.R.E.S will temporarily pause operations beginning Jan. 1. The organization says the move is aimed at long-term sustainability while ensuring children continue to receive support through partner agencies.

entry.title: Coos County Man Arraigned on Murder, Kidnapping Charges After Courthouse Disruption
entry.summary: A Coos County man faces multiple felony charges, including murder and kidnapping, after a fatal shooting in Coos Bay. Police say the suspect disrupted his arraignment and is accused of killing a man in a Staples parking lot and threatening another victim.

entry.title: Douglas County sheriff's office staff praised for exemplary service
entry.summary: The Douglas County Sheriff’s Office recently celebrated outstanding achievements by its staff, highlighting their commitment to public safety and professionalism.

entry.title: Wallet Left Behind Leads to Arrest in Roseburg Burglary Case
entry.summary: A Roseburg man faces multiple charges after allegedly breaking into a home and leaving behind his wallet at the scene. Police say the suspect fled before officers arrived but was later identified and jailed on burglary and theft charges.

entry.title: Roseburg burglary suspect identified by wallet left at scene
entry.summary: A 35-year-old Roseburg man was charged Monday with multiple charges after being following an alleged home burglary incident, according to Douglas County Circuit Court records and the Roseburg Police Department.

entry.title: DOUGLAS COUNTY SHERIFF’S OFFICE ANNOUNCES STAFF AWARDS
entry.summary: January 1, 2025 12:30 p.m. The Douglas County Sheriff’s Office has announced awards and recognitions presented during the month of December. Undersheriff Brad O’Dell said the awards went to staff members whose service, leadership and actions exemplify the highest standards of public safety and professionalism. Lieutenant Kelley Bean was honored by the Oregon State Sheriff’s...

entry.title: Douglas CARES closing immediately
entry.summary: Douglas CARES, which provides critical medical and psychological exams for abused and neglected children, as well as counseling for them and their families, is shutting down for at least a month due to a funding shortage.

entry.title: NEW YEAR’S HOLIDAY CLOSURES
entry.summary: January 1, 2026 7:00 a.m. Thursday, January 1st is New Year’s Day and there are a number of closures. Federal, state, county, and city offices are closed. Regular mail will not be delivered. Schools remain out of session. Banks and credit unions will not be open. Professional offices are closed. Some retail outlets may be...

entry.title: Longtime Southern Oregon Philanthropist Wanda Olsrud Dies at 100
entry.summary: Wanda Olsrud, longtime Southern Oregon philanthropist and co-founder of the Sherm’s Thunderbird and Food 4 Less brands, has died at age 100. Her decades of quiet generosity helped shape local communities, youth programs, and healthcare across the region.

entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 12.31.25
entry.summary: An encore program: Kyle Bailey and Rachelle Carter talk about the Fly Away Travel trip to Italy last fall.

entry.title: Police Log - December 30, 2025
entry.summary: Roseburg police handled multiple calls over Dec. 30, ranging from traffic crashes and warrant arrests to disorderly conduct and a reported domestic incident, according to the department’s daily activity log.

entry.summary: Ring in 2026 across Douglas County with live music, themed parties, comedy, and celebrations at local favorites like The Rosebud, Melrose Vineyards, Seven Feathers, and more. Here’s your guide to New Year’s Eve events happening around the county.

entry.title: Former Sutherlin middle school instructor pleads not guilty to sex abuse charges
entry.summary: A former Sutherlin Middle School instructor who is accused of sexually abusing two students appeared in court Tuesday, where she pleaded not guilty to all charges against her.

entry.title: AIR STAGNATION ADVISORY CONTINUES UNTIL 4:00 P.M. WEDNESDAY
entry.summary: December 31, 2025 4:00 p.m. An Air Stagnation Advisory continues until 4:00 p.m. Wednesday for central Douglas County, its eastern foothills, and much of southern Oregon. Forecasters at the National Weather Service in Medford said air quality is likely to worsen through Wednesday afternoon. This is due to an inversion and stagnant air conditions near...

entry.title: GUIDED FIRST DAY HIKES SET FOR NEW YEAR’S DAY IN OREGON STATE PARKS
entry.summary: December 31, 2025 3:50 a.m. Oregon Parks and Recreation Department is offering a First Day Hike at 25 parks around the state. An OPRD release said rangers and volunteers will lead the hikes around the state with distances ranging from a quarter-mile stroll to a 5-mile trek. Hikes are free, but a day-use parking permit...

entry.title: SHERIFF’S OFFICE CONTINUES ENHANCED DUII PATROLS THROUGH THURSDAY
entry.summary: December 31, 2025 3:40 a.m. The Douglas County Sheriff’s Office is continuing enhanced DUII patrols through New Years Day. Undersheriff Brad O’Dell said DCSO is partnering with federal and state efforts to remind residents about the dangers of drunk driving. O’Dell said the lifesaving message is: “Drive Sober or Get Pulled Over”. O’Dell said deputies...

entry.title: BACKSIDE BREWING CO. ANNOUNCES CHANGE OF OWNERSHIP
entry.summary: December 31, 2025 3:05 a.m. In the KQEN Business Spotlight: Backside Brewing Co. has announced a change of ownership effective January 1st. The popular micro-brewery was created by KC McKillip back in the 2000s and officially became a location on Northeast Odell Avenue in Roseburg in 2012. Food and liquor were added to their menu...
